resources.string: Daily Bed Statement Register (For RHC only)
Number of ANC Revisits (2/3/4 or more)
Number of live births in the facility
Number of live births with LBW
Number of stillbirths in the facility
Number of newborns with birth asphyxia
Number of women provided misoprostol after delivery
Number of newborns to whom chlorhexadine gel is applied to umbilical stumps
Number of child deaths (1 to 4 years)
Number of Pneumonia cases/ ARI 5 years (OPD)
Deaths due to Pneumonia cases/ ARI <5 years (Indoor)
Deaths due to Diarrhea among <5 years (Indoor)
Main Source of Water for Labor Rooms, Toilets and Theaters. 24/7 (Main Source)
Alternative Source of Water in case of Main Source is Non Functional
Hand Washing /Hygiene Facility in Waiting Area, Labor Rooms, OPDs, Toilets and Theaters.
Waste Disposal Bins for Dry Waste
Waste Disposal Bins for Wet Waste
Electricity Main Source for OPDs, Waiting Area, Labor Rooms, Toilets and Theaters.
Electricity Alternative Source (Generator) for OPDs, Waiting Area, Labor Rooms, Toilets and Theaters.
Contact List of Near By CEmONC Centers
Supplies & Equipment’s for, Routine OPD & IPD Care (General Items and Furniture)
Supplies Equipment’s for, Neonatal & Child Health
Laboratory within Premises for baseline biomarkers (CBC, Blood Group & RH factor, Hepatitis B & C, Urine DR)
Communications with Peripheral 24 Hour Blood Bank Services
Trained Staff Nurses, Midwives, Nurse Aids (OB/GYN & PEADS)
Separate Area for storage of Essential drugs
Availability of essential drugs (3 Months Supplies)
Injection Syntocinon (Oxytocin) with maintained cold chain
IEC Material / Job Aids related to MNCH
Supplies & Instruments (For General Items and Furniture)
waiting bench for high volume facilities
Refrigerator (for facility providing Immunization & Maternal services)
BP Apparatus- functional (at least one per service site)
Stethoscope - functional(at least one per service site)
Safety Box for used syringes / needles
Two separate Tub or Bucket with Lid for Chlorine & Detergent Water
Stand for chlorine buckets or tubs
Plastic sheets to cover waste bins
Double-ended, Sims Vaginal medium size/Cusco’s Vaginal Speculum medium size
One Jug (1L), 6 Cups(50 ml), 6 cups ( 100 ml), 12 Spoon(5ml )
Instrument tray with drawer to store items
Greets the woman and respond her nicely on asking questions
WHO-recommended schedule of ANC visits: 1st visit: <16 weeks, 2nd visit: 24–28 weeks, 3rd visit: 30–32 weeks, 4th visit: 36–38 weeks
Screened & Describe Women for Danger Signs during Pregnancy
Convulsions/loss of consciousness, 2. Severe Headache, 3. Blurred Vision, 4. Respiratory Difficulty, 5. Fever, 6. Severe Abdominal Pain, 7. Vaginal Bleeding
Measures vital signs (blood pressure, temperature, pulse and respiration)
Listens to fetal heart sounds (after 20 weeks)
Determines fetal lie and presentation (after 36 weeks)
Calculate & Document the EDD according to LMP or By First Early Scan.
Routine investigation (blood group and Rh factor, complete blood count, blood glucose, urine analysis for proteinuria, hepatitis B, & hepatitis C)
Specific investigation if needed (Pre Eclampsia Profile (Urea, Creatanine, Uric Acid & LFTs), HIV & Syphilis and ultrasound)
Verifies tetanus toxoid vaccine to all pregnant women
Iron folic acid and calcium supplement prescribed to women
Strength and frequency of contractions (every hourly)
Maternal pulse and blood pressure (every hourly)
Give uterotonics within one minute after the baby is born. (Oxytocin OR Misoprostol)
Maintained Partograph and Delivery Notes on Record Sheets
Thoroughly dries baby, stimulates baby and covers baby’s head immediately
Places baby on mother’s chest in skin-to-skin contact
Ventilate Baby through Bag & Mask (If Needed)
Delays cord cutting until pulsation stops (2–3 minutes)
Applies CHX to the cord stump and encourage the mother to continue application for 7 days.
Encourages mother to start breastfeeding within one hour of delivery
Administered appropriate prophylactic antibiotics to women with rupture of membrane
Administered antibiotics to women with early signs of infection (temp > 38 degrees C or foul-smelling vaginal discharge)
Causes of PPH identified and managed properly and documented.
Administers oxytocin 20 IU in 1L of IV fluid at 60 drops/minute and then continue on 40 drops/minute. IV fluid limit is 2-3 Liters.
Administered 04 Tablets of Misoprostol (800mcg) Sub Lingual or Per Rectally.
Do not administered more than 3 liters containing Oxytocin, Also Not give as an IV Bolos.
Diagnosis & Management of Pre Eclampsia / Eclampsia
Pre Eclampsia identified and managed properly and documented.
Anti-hypertensive (Nifidipine or Hydralazine) and anti convulsant (Magnesium Sulphate) medication for pre-Eclampsia/Eclampsia administered and documented.

Monitor following signs: 1. Level of consciousness/ Convulsions, 2. Severe Headache, 3. Blurred Vision, 4. Difficulty in Breathing and Respiratory rate, 5. Vital Signs, 6. Tendon Reflux, 7. Urine Output (Amount and Proteinuria)
Routine Post Natal Examination of Mother & Newborn
Greets the woman and respond her nicely on asking questions. Provider had complete newborn examination.
Encourages the mother to breastfeed exclusively, and Counsels the mother and family member on the importance of completing child immunizations according to schedule
Screened & Describe Women for Danger Signs of Newborn

Screened and Demonstrates about Danger Signs of Newborn: 1. lethargic or unconscious, 2. convulsions, 3. vomiting, 4. not able to suck properly, 5. difficulty in breathing, 6. very cold or warm on touch, and 7. oozing from Umbilical Stump.
WHO-recommended schedule of PNC visits: 1st visit: 24 hours after birth, 2nd visit: 3rd day after birth, 3rd visit: 7-14th day after birth, 4th visit: at six weeks
Screened & Describe Women for Danger Signs after delivery

Convulsions/loss of consciousness, 2. Severe Headache, 3. Blurred Vision, 4. Respiratory Difficulty, 5. Fever, 6. Severe Abdominal Pain, 7. Severe Vaginal Bleeding, and 8. Foul Smelling Vaginal Discharge
Indication for Cesarean Section and time decision for surgery was documented
Lab results (Hb%, Platelets, Blood Group RH factor, Hepatitis B & C, ) Attached or documented.
Written Informed consent was signed and attached
IV Antibiotics for prophylaxis was given and documented
Blood is arranged and cross matched before surgery
Gives utero tonic, delays cord clamping 1 -3 minutes, clamps and cuts cord, delivers placenta using controlled cord traction, and ensures adequate uterine tone.
Ensure immediate newborn care is provided.
Completes Operative Note, Post-Op Orders, and ensures safe transfer to recovery area.
Monitors and ensures proper post-operative course, Post-Partum Family Planning, Post Natal Counseling, Immunization of Newborn, Exclusive Breast Feeding and discharge.
Indication for blood transfusion and blood components; includes Hb%, WBC, Platelets results
Informed consent is properly signed and attached.
Patient’s blood Group type (ABO and RhD) verified and documented
Time of transfusion started, infusion rate, and time of transfusion completed was documented

Patient\'s General appearance, Temperature, Blood Pressure, Pulse, Respiratory Rate, Fluid balance and signs of transfusion reaction like rash, fever, restlessness, worsening hypotension and/or tachycardia were checked and documented during following time period
2. During Transfusion (After 15 minutes of transfusion, then hourly until transfusion completed)
Diagnosis & Management of cough or difficulty in breathing
Assess child presenting with cough and/or difficult breathing
Classifies the child as per protocol
Treats/refers the child as per protocol
Provides counseling on medication and home care
Assess diarrhea and dehydration in sick child.
Classifies diarrhea and dehydration in sick child
Counsels caregiver on four rules of home treatment
Infection Prevention at different sites of Clinic / Maternity Home / Hospital
Washing area for used instruments/sterilization and HLD processing area
Proper disposable area for medical waste, sharps and needles handling
Facility has a system of linkages in place for referring women/child in case of complication to THQ/DHQ or Tertiary care hospitals.
Check and verify by record from OPD register or slips in referral boxes
